mechanoreception.notes: Sea urchins, including members of Echinidae, possess mechanoreceptors for detecting touch and vibrations. These are inferred to be common in the family.

chemoreception.notes: Sea urchins, including members of Echinidae, likely use chemoreceptors to detect chemical cues in the water for finding food and mates. This is inferred to be common in the family.

photoreception.notes: The presence and nature of photoreception within the Echinidae family is currently unknown from the context.
